reviews.review_msg: Dr. Ray is a great prof. Learning about Indian history from her feels like a breath of fresh air. She is extremely passionate about the subject which makes learning much easier. The topics she covers are interesting and she makes lecture easy to follow, however, there is a good bit of reading to do, but nothing crazy. Marks a little hard imo.

Dr Ray tries... She's clearly passionate but not the greatest teacher.
 She has an unfortunate tendency for interrupting her students if she thinks they're wrong or knows where their point is going. Its giving ADHD tbh. 
Attendance is mandatory but class is 90% breaking into groups and discussing readings. ðŸ™„ 
Projects are creative and fun though!

Dr. Ray was quite approachable, and she explained our assignments in depth with multiple examples/templates. The course was super fun, as the content was quite interesting! The course work was also decent-- only 3 assignments, an academic journal, and participation. There was no midterm or final. I loved HIST-130, I recommend it to everyone!

Decent prof. This is by no means a gpa booster but you can get by if you read ahead and discuss the assignment details carefully. Overall easy course requirements wise but grading is slightly strict so give it ur all but in a smart way. Better confirm thing ahead rather than regretting later as they say

My fav teacher at SFU so far. Caring, sweet and engaging with students. She was my tutorial instructor as well and a joy to talk to. Very interesting assignments and very clear rubrics, with example assignments provided. Wasn't a fan of history, I now would love to take another class with her. Really cares for the students well beings and success.

Loveddd her, so sweet and caring. There were no quizzes or exams in this class, just written assignments. She's a very easy marker and gives good feedback. She was my TA in my tutorial as well and sparked some great conversations. Super nice, she feels like a role model.

Dr. Ray is an incredibly caring and attentive professor who genuinely cares about her fellow faculty and students. She was always very understanding and very easy on her students. I recommend taking her classes!
Dr. Ray is an amazing prof! I strongly suggest taking this class!

Easily one of my worst university experiences. Prof. Ray made such an interesting topic dull by cancelling lectures and assigning impossible volumes of readings. It's a highschool style environment where she cold calls, and doesn't facilitate constructive conversations. Expect to be scolded in front of your peers.

Dr. Ray did cancel many classes -- kids, injuries...etc
She really cared about the course subject and was very informative. That said we rarely got slides or any structured learning -- mostly discussion where she told us stuff. 
The assignments were creative/different, weren't hard and were enjoyable but... were marked a bit harshly.
Very lazy teacher, Cancels class last minute. Readings are over 200 pages every week. Most of the class consists of discussing the textbook in groups of 2-4. Would not take again.

Very rude, if you are not a native-speaker, she will heavily discredit your grammar in assignments.

Cancelled class less than 45min before the start.

Unprofessional.

Participation points require you to go to office hours, ask questions, email her, but when you do, she comes off as you're bothering her and to go read the syllabus.

She expects participation (20% of total grade) but is very judgmental unless you grasped exactly what she thought was important. 

She comes across as very rude and passive-aggressive when students (the whole class) highlighted how they got marked down for not using sources in her book review despite not being mandatory in the criterias.

Over 7 chapters of readings per week,makes you buy 4 books.She is very lazy, you dont learn anything in class, she sits down and makes you do group discussions for 3 hours about readings. She takes over 3 weeks to return a 500 word paper. She mocks you when she disagrees with something you say in class. Worst prof ive ever had.Made me hate learning

NOT the gpa booster ur looking for if ur not ready to read before each class, had her class online. was terrible, emailed her once for help, she posted an email informing everyone in the class to not email her w/ full rules (this was mid-semester). she's nice, cares but provides no feedback for grades or essays. cold calls on you, read beforehand.

Such a genuine Prof. Facilitates amazing class discussions and offers a wealth of information to every topic. Lots of reading so make sure you keep on top of it, a large percentage of your grade is based on your own personal reflection to the course material so try to do that each week and it should be an easy class to do well in.

It was an OK class, but very dry and she had really strange participation requirements -- you got extra credit for showing photos that you attended an Indian cultural event, or if you asked her questions about outside readings, but only got a B if you showed up to class, answered questions, and did the required reading. Hard pass.

Interesting subject, but poor delivery. Class average was B- to C+ range, with assignments being graded very harshly. Participation is 25% of grade, but it's not easy participation - you have to go to office hours, ask questions, show you've ready outside books, and even then you just get a B. Many students were discouraged. Not a GPA booster!

Her choice of usual assignments allowed for outside of the box thinking. I have one complaint with her grading when it comes to participation. All throughout the semester I was receiving As and then at the end of the semester I was blind sided by a bad participation grade, which she did amend after many emails. It still annoys me to this day.

She is a nice person to talk to, however, she is a very hard marker. During the first day of class she told the entire class that it is impossible for anyone to receive an A in her class. If you're looking for a GPA booster this is not the class for you. Her marking is based on her take and opinion on the subject, so always ask her for extra help.

Dr. Ray is fantastic! She was without a doubt my favourite prof this past semester, and is one of the best I've had in awhile. She's very caring, and was always available for extra help outside of class. She also tries to avoid using traditional assignments (20% of our grade was based on a personal journal for example) which I really liked

There were 13 classes in the semester and Bidisha cancelled SIX of them. Once she cancelled a class shortly  before it was about to start, when really she was "in a car accident" the day before and could have cancelled it then (as she did for her other class). She is inconsiderate and I want my money back. I would never take a class with her again.

Overall she is passionate about the topic of what she teaches but what she wants from tests and papers is unclear. Gives a guide of what is expected and when that is followed she states that that information is not what she was looking for. A lot of people were very unsatisfied with her marking too.

Very interesting class. She is kind and humorous. It is important to attend lectures, if you don't I don't think it would be easy to figure out exactly what the important material is (as there is no "real" chapter by chapter textbook). Would recommend.

Dr Ray is really good! Great lecturer in a unique subject. May seem a little aggressive but she's actually very nice & helpful. Lenient marker. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Textbooks not really needed, focus on lecture slides. Tends to end lecture early but starts tutorial early. Only problem is tutorial readings can be sometimes unclear.

Informative and interesting lectures. Lets out early for almost every class. She doesn't give out a syllabus, so you have to figure out which chapters to read, but her lectures correspond to readings fairly well. Tests were two essay questions out of four, so they were very easy to prepare for, and two in class quizzes. Lenient marker.

A truly inspiring and talented scholar with a great sense of humor and considerable insight into the politics of gender and identity. She demands commitment from her students but makes learning history a thoroughly rewarding experience. Always willing to help students succeed and fully grasp concepts.

she's the greatest. Her instructions are sometimes not the clearest but she's really approachable and engaging. Knows her stuff and wonderful sense of humor. Check ur email often and pay attention in lecture. Forgiving marker.
Fantastic professor. Clearly cares deeply about the material and her students, was always very accessible for any extra help and would go out of her way to give it.  Also had a great sense of humour.
Love her teaching style. She's a real talented historian. I thoroughly enjoy listening to her talk about Indian history and her opinions.

loved this class! you can tell she knows her stuff and that she's really passionate about it too.. assignments aren't hard and the class itself was super interesting! would definitely take another class with her!
